revised_title: The Role of Biological Context and Environmental Factors in Language Acquisition
tldr: This article discusses the role of biological context and environmental factors in language acquisition. The author argues that language acquisition is a complex process involving multiple interlocking dependencies. They propose a contingency model that considers the influence of innate factors, prior learning, and environmental input in the development of language abilities. The author also highlights the importance of the species-typical environment in shaping language development and the limitations of using the term "innate" in explaining these processes.
